oai_dc:dc.dc:title: A NUMERICAL MODEL OF WAVE DEFORMATION IN SURF ZONE
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Watanabe, Akira
Dibajnia, Mohammad
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: surf zone
numerical model
wave deformation
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A numerical model is presented for nearshore wave deformation due to shoaling and breaking, and to decay and recovery in the surf zone. The model is based on a set of time-dependent mild slope equations including a term of wave energy dissipation caused by breaking. Its applicability is demonstrated by comparisons between the computations and the measurements of cross-shore distributions of the wave height and potential energy over typical beach configurations.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Coastal Engineering Proceedings; No. 21 (1988): Proceedings of 21st Conference on Coastal Engineering, Torremolinos, Spain, 1988.; 41
